recommendations.recommendation: Great series for Sonic The Hedgehog fans, especially the fans who loved the Sonic Adventure games. Of course, some of the human characters were a disappointment (like Chris never being actually useful until the last season) but overall a great series for fans.

I won`t recommend this for fans of Sonic the Hedgehog. I can see that a lot of comments and complaints have been made floating around Sonic X and I can see that everyone is confused about this. Most complaints are the addition of Chris (or human characters) and the copy with Sonic Adventure and Sonic Adventure 2. I don`t think this show is awful, but I recommend it`s great for little kids.

I suggest watching to end to decide for yourself. I loved it since it is rare to see "sonic" outside of games and with a full series. The games tied to the same setting of the series Is among my Favorite. And im jus as Nostaligic of player for Sonic games as they get. HardCopy Of the Movie even. My only peeve is ithe dubb voice for Knuckles is attrocious.

anime.description: Going after the seven legendary stones, the "Chaos Emerald", Sonic and friends continue to fight the evil genius professor Dr. Eggman. The moment Sonic entered Eggman`s headquarters, the seven Chaos emeralds gathered and created a large "Chaos Control", which blew Sonic and the others through time into the human world. There, Sonic met a kind boy, Chris... All of them were separated in an unknown world. Will they be able to reunite? And what will happen to Eggman`s world domination plan... ? Note: The series was broadcast for 52 episodes on TV Tokyo between April 6, 2003 and March 28, 2004. However, episodes 53 through 78 were broadcast together with the rest only outside of Japan in the US and France while a decision to broadcast them in Japan was never made. The Japanese versions of the remaining episodes were later made available for streaming online in August 2009.

tag.name: baseball
tag.description: Baseball is like a complicated version of Rounders. It involves hitting a ball with a stick, then running around several bases placed in the form of a diamond on a field. Big in the US, and also in Japan.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time travel
tag.description: In time travel anime characters are transported through time either figuratively or literally to find themselves either in the past or the future

tag.name: absurdist humour
tag.description: Surreal humour, also known as absurdist humour, is a form of humour predicated on deliberate violations of causal reasoning, producing events and behaviours that are obviously illogical. Constructions of surreal humour tend to involve bizarre juxtapositions, non-sequiturs, irrational or absurd situations, and expressions of nonsense. The humour arises from a subversion of audience`s expectations, so that amusement is founded on unpredictability, separate from a logical analysis of the situation. Its appeal stems from the fact that the situation described is exceedingly ridiculous or unlikely. On an analytical level, all jokes contain a certain amount of incongruity, but while regular jokes carry an incongruity that the audience accepts as compatible with expectations, absurd jokes are characterized by a disproportionate amount of it, with the punch line delivering a situation incompatible with the world as we know it and failing to resolve the matter in the audience`s eyes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: medium awareness
tag.description: Medium awareness is the situational and generally temporary awareness characters in works of fiction have and display of the very fact that they are characters in works of fiction. For example, they may comment about the background music, quip about the script or narration, complain about the roles given to them by the writer or their lack of screen time, see the subtitles that appear on screen, inform the audience about the arrival of the commercial break, and even use medium effects as tools. The most common form of medium awareness is known as breaking the fourth wall, in which characters speak directly to the audience, either to it as a whole or to specific members of it. The "fourth wall" is the imaginary "wall" at the front of the stage of a proscenium theatre through which the audience sees the play; it is a metaphor for the boundary between what happens inside the work, to the characters, and outside it, to the audience.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: action game
tag.description: Any game where reflexes are the key to the gameplay, violence is optional.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Knuckles the Echidna
character.description: Knuckles is the last surviving echidna and the sole guardian of the Master Emerald. He is from Angel Island and is the only resident of the floating island. While he`s shy and isolated, he is friends and allies with the Sonic and friends, though he often considers Sonic a friendly rival of sorts. He is the most physically powerful and durable of Sonic`s friends and can be characterized as serious, gullible, and quick to anger.

character.name: Shadow the Hedgehog
character.description: Shadow is an artificial created life form in the design of a male, anthropomorphic hedgehog. He resembles Sonic in many ways, such as how his hover skates propel him at extreme speeds to rival those of Sonic; but he distinguishes himself with greater use of his signature ability to use Chaos Control with Chaos Emeralds. He is Sonic`s rival and is the anti thesis of Sonic himself in all aspects of Shadow`s life. Rings in his hands are sealing his true power.

character.name: Tikal The Echidna
character.description: Tikal is the daughter of Chief Pachacamac from the same tribe that Knuckles the Echidna descends. She first appears in Sonic Adventure and returns in Sonic Adventure 2 as a bonus character. Thousands of years before the main events of the series, she opposes her father`s power-hungry ways of invading other countries. She eventually comes into contact with Chaos and a group of Chao at the shrine of the Master Emerald, who accept her due to her friendliness to them. She tries to change her father`s mind about raiding the shrine for the emeralds, but he refuses to listen. After Pachacamac raids the shrine, angering Chaos, Tikal recites a poem taught to her by her grandmother and figures out how to use the Master Emerald`s power. She then seals herself and Chaos into the emerald. Several thousand years later, Doctor Eggman shatters the Master Emeralds and awakens the angry Chaos and Tikal`s spirit. Tikal helps the main characters defeat Chaos, and then leaves with Chaos.

character.name: Cheese The Chao
character.description: Cheese is the chao that`s always with Cream. The bowtie distinguishes this chao from other chao. She cannot talk, but she can just about melt any heart. Cheese is not Cream`s pet, but rather a close friend. In the US version of the episode where Cheese gets lost, Chris refers to Cheese as "she" when he says "she must be so scared", which indicates that Cheese is female. In the Japanese version, Cheese is called a "he" in episode 16, but is then also referred to as a female in episode 22, thus indicating that Cheese is genderless, just like all Chao. In the videogames, however, Cheese is apparently male.

However, the ship isn`t big enough for Sonic to run on, at all. Everyone is worried, so an airlift is called in to send Sonic away, but Tanaka is on it, and he has a group of elderly women on board. He says they will be their coaches, guiding them on how to relax, leaving Sonic on the ship, just as he tricks Tails into thinking the X Tornado is lonely, and lies to Amy that she is the cutest thing he`s ever seen (lol!). He finally gives in to all the influences, and goes ahead, with the entire country watching this show down, as well as the president.

However, when Sonic is fighting, some sort of computer chip lands in Sonic`s ear, causing him to pick his ears for the rest of the day (which Amy hates!). When a remote is pressed, Sonic goes berserk, and then begins to run fast and uncontrollably into the desert. The gang has to come up with ways to stop him, with the assist from Knuckles and Sam, but to their luck, they all fail, and Sam is no help either. What will they do?

episode.summary: Now we`re on the wire. Six Chaos Emerald have been found, but Eggman has one, and plans to use his E-77 robot to seek out the last one. Meanwhile, Knuckles is looking for the Last Chaos Emerald too. He realizes that the only way for him, Sonic, Tails, Chris, Amy, Cream, and Cheese to get all the Chaos Emeralds is to team up with Eggman. So Knuckles visits the Thorndyke residence, but Sonic, Tails, Cream, Amy, and Cheese are out looking for the last Chaos Emereald as well, so Knuckles teams up with Chris to go to Eggman`s base and ask for a partnership. Eggman agrees, but he asks if he can hold the Chaos Emeralds that they have, and foolishly Knuckles agrees. Chris and Knuckles try to keep it a secret from Sonic, Tails, Amy, Cream, and Cheese though. Meanwhile, it turns out that Eggman tricked him, and he steals the Chaos Emeralds for himself...as E-77 is returning with the last Chaos Emerald....what will happen next?

However, with the power of seven Chaos Emeralds, it`s not that easy. Sonic is bruised and beaten... badly. Chris can`t stand the sight of his hero beaten up, and actually breaks himself free to grab the emeralds and jump in the water to help Sonic. Behold! Super Sonic rises out and destroys E-99, and then a blast of Chaos Control is released, as Station Square watches in awe.

Sonic and Chris board a landing vessel to find the Planet Egg, but Sonic gets captured by the Metarex. Chris ends up having to save Sonic using the skills he had acquired over the past six years in his own world. Source: Wikipedia

Sonic struggles in the fight and scatters the seven Chaos Emeralds across the galaxy, and a Metarex robot, Metarex Spike, ends up robbing the planet of its life source, the Planet Egg. Then, an 18 year old Chris warps to Sonic`s planet using a machine he created, but ends up reverting to the body of a 12 year old due to a time dilation between the worlds. Source: Wikipedia

They end up being repelled by the Sonic Driver, but Sonic is hurled towards the planet from the weapon`s sheer force. Amy, Cream and Cosmo decide to look for him, but on the way they meet Metarex King Ape, who keeps a stolen Planet Egg. Source: Wikipedia

Hearing that, Sonic and his friends decide to depart into space. However, they are once again attacked by Metarex Spike while building the space ship. Sonic is then used as a bullet for the space ship`s primary weapon, the Sonic Driver, to defeat Metarex Spike. Source: Wikipedia

Its next target is Blue Typhoon, which is boarded by Sonic and friends. With even Shadow driven into this predicament, Sonic and the others are forced to find a way to combat the new threat. Source: Wikipedia

The stalling Blue Typhoon is then attacked by one of the four Metarex bosses, the power-boasting Yellow Zelkova. Source: Wikipedia

In it was a single ticket with "One-Way Trip to Earth" written on it. Source: Wikipedia

As if they`re responding to Cosmo`s prayers, the Chaos Emeralds get back their power once again, and Super Sonic and Super Shadow stand tall, shining in gold. The duo`s fierce attacks destroy the outer layer of the nut, finally blowing it up into pieces, but this is not at all the end of their problems. Cosmo learns of her true purpose and Tails is forced to make a difficult decision. Source: Wikipedia

They locate the Chaos Emeralds and a Planet Egg, but this is where they realize the situation is a lot more complicated. Source: Wikipedia

Their plan is to strike the Chaos Emeralds with the Master Emerald`s energy via the Sonic Driver`s mechanism. Shadow and the Chaotix join the group as well, and initiate the operation while forcing back Final Mova`s attacks the best they can. In the midst of the fight, Eggman informs Chris the shocking truth. Source: Wikipedia

She shows interest in Shadow, who is as strong as the legendary hero Black Wind. Shadow, Rouge and Molly follow the Chaos Emerald`s signal and head to Cascade`s mining site, but this is where they learn that one of Molly`s comrades could potentially be working with the Metarex. Source: Wikipedia

Instead of securing the Chaos Emerald, Sonic and his friends return the trio`s ship to their home planet Marmolim, which the group learns is struck with a disease that encases its Planet Egg. Source: Wikipedia

episode.summary: Sonic and the others are met with a Metarex army led by Dark Oak, who watched them in wait. The group is then surrounded by the Metarex army that circled the fortress, realizing this was all a trap. Sonic attempts to escape, but with the Chaos Emeralds all in one place, he and Shadow are locked in a showdown. Source: Wikipedia
